meanings.definition: The amount that can be held or contained in the mouth at one time.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't speak with so many mouthfuls of food.
meanings.sent2: He took small mouthfuls of soup to savor the flavor.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to fit three mouthfuls of treats in its tiny mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like mouthfuls of sweetness, comforting and warm.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing joy was like taking in mouthfuls of sunshine.

meanings.definition: A small amount of food or drink that is chewed or swallowed at one time.
meanings.sent1: The toddler took tiny mouthfuls of the apple slices.
meanings.sent2: She savored each mouthful of the delicious chocolate cake.
meanings.sent3: The bird chirped happily after each mouthful of seeds.
meanings.sent4: The music was a mouthful of emotions, overwhelming yet beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air was like a mouthful of freedom after being indoors all day.
